alert.note: Alert for Mayes; Rogers; Wagoner (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued October 04 at 7:33PM CDT until October 04 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 800 PM CDT FOR SOUTHERN ROGERS...SOUTHWESTERN MAYES AND NORTH CENTRAL WAGONER COUNTIES... At 733 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 3 miles west of Claremore to 3 miles northeast of Verdigris to 6 miles east of Catoosa, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...80 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be heavily damaged. Expect considerable damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles. Extensive tree damage and power outages are likely. Locations in or near the path include... Claremore... Owasso... Catoosa... Verdigris... Inola... Taiwah... Tiawah... This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 233 and 258. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...DESTRUCTIVE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...80 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
